review: A year old and still in beta...and it shows.  Choppy playback and frequent lockups.  Also, your phone/tablet/laptop doesn't send its screen to the TV as done with AllShare Cast or MiraCast.  Instead it controls the ChromeCast, with the data for the ChromeCast coming from your home wi-fi access point's connection to the internet.  Not very good for me, where Sprint's unlimited cell phone data plan is my only broadband connection.  Also, I don't want to put my devices on hacker friendly public access points in hotel rooms.  Besides, it only cost about $30 more to get a Blu-Ray player with AllShare / MiraCast, and they also provide playback of Redbox DVD rentals.
author: W. Jones
